cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 mi ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest along/just north of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest across the Florida Keys this weekend and then move inland toward the Florida Panhandle–Alabama coast early Monday, continuing north toward the Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / far eastern Alabama coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and the southwest coast of Florida from Bonita Beach south and east to Ocean Reef including Florida Bay; portions of central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, south-central Florida Peninsula, Florida Panhandle, Alabama and portions of the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Ohio or Great Lakes point listed in table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast mentions heavier totals mainly over Southeast US; expected totals over Ohio well under 4 inches)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at the port; only breezy conditions possible as remnant low passes mid-week
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture may bring periods of moderate rain 1–2 inches around 18–19 Aug
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations
